conclusion: Analyze how movement of light source to back right affects shadows of four objects.
Shadows are formed when light is blocked by objects.
Direction of light source determines direction of shadows.
If light source moves to back right, shadows will shift towards front left.
Shadow A (Apple) will move towards front left.
Shadow B (Paper) will move towards front left.
Shadow C (Glass) will move towards front left.
Shadow D (Drumstick) will move towards front left.
Shadows elongate when light source is at lower angle relative to objects.
With light source moving to back right, shadows likely become longer and more stretched out.
Shadows (A, B, C, and D) will shift towards front left.
Shadows will become longer due to change in angle of light source.
Final Answer: Shadows (A, B, C, and D) will shift towards front left and become longer.
